summary: The Pretty Diva No Wipe UV led Holographic Nail Hologram is very pretty, especially in natural light. The tiny small jar will probably do at least 100 nails based on the amount of powder in it. This is NOT a nail dip powder like Revel.
evidence:
I recommend not completely curing the gel top coat (just leaving off a few seconds) so there's just tge slightest tack for the pigment to adhere to for best coverage (I used onedor no wipe gel top coat btw) Love it. | Use any polish, buy Pretty Diva No Wipe UV led Gel, once polish is dry apply the Gel, place in UV nail machine for about a minute.
Your Gel will be firm but not totally set, use the eye shadow tool and dip in the holographic powder and lightly cover and then still lightly rubbing in a circle until you are happy with effect.
Use your free hand and lightly rub in andvoff the excess powder.
Then apply one more coat of Gel, place nails in the UV machine for about 3 minutes and you will have nails so pretty!!
Lots of complements, the effect is more pronounced with dark colors. | Super easy to use and beautiful results!.
pos_snippets: I recommend not completely curing the gel top coat (just leaving off a few seconds) so there's just tge slightest tack for the pigment to adhere to for best coverage (I used onedor no wipe gel top coat btw) Love it. | Black is very pretty as well as Dark Blues ect.

evidence:
Amazing results.

NASA called, Webb telescope wants its mirror finish back.

UV gel steps:
-prep nails (file, push cuticle, lightly buff w coarse buffer, cleanse w alcohol to remove ALL debris and oils)
-tip: apply all coats thinly, THIN = STRONG, thick = will settle and cure thicker at tip and edges, prone to lifting peeling
-tip: remove uncured UV gel booboos from cuticle edges BEFORE they cure ROCK HARD on skin
-base coat, cure LED lamp (all cure cycles 60 seconds)
-color 1st coat, cure LED lamp (black no-wipe UV gel polish if you'll be using chrome powders) "no-wipe" means no tackiness after curing, no need to wipe w alcohol cleanser
-color 2nd coat, cure LED lamp (black no-wipe UV gel polish if you'll be using chrome powders)
-apply dusting of chrome powder, GENTLY rub in w eye shadow applicator, silicone applicator (love this tool, also found at art supply stores), NO OIL CROSS CONTAMINATION from fingertip or cuticle
-perfectly prepped and cured surface should yield mirror finish and color shift; if spots don't take powder, wipe seletively w alcohol cleanser and reapply powder, I achieved 100% coverage and blending
-tacky surface may yield less mirror and more "glitter-like" appearance
-top coat 1st coat (same clear as base coat), cure LED lamp
-top coat 2nd coat optional, cure; wipe tackiness w alcohol cleanser
-apply cuticle oil
-marvel at your accomplishment Goegeous. | Yes, it's expensive, however, it's still only $20, and Very easy to use and looks beautiful. | Seems expensive but you only need a little so it lasts Works great.

summary: The battery life of this razor is below-specified. The LCD display is nothing more useful than a gimmick. The space under the heads which catches the beard shavings is very small. This shaver completely died in less than 3 months of use.
evidence:
The run time was tested and found to be only 30 minutes in 5 minute on, five minute off intervals, just free running and not being used to shave which should further reduce the run time slightly.

The charge indicator was at 52 after 25 minutes and then rapidly dropped from that to 10 only five minutes later causing the low battery indicator to flash, so They are apparently not calculating percent charge remaining and displaying it on the LCD, they are simply and far less usefully displaying percent battery VOLTAGE which drops off rapidly at what is called the battery's discharge "knee." A cheap route to take revealing that the LCD display is nothing more useful than a gimmick.

The manual states that the razor should be unplugged from the charger (this razor package does not come with an AC to USB charge adapter) when the charge number reaches 99, so So,

Other information:

The space under the heads which catches the beard shavings is very small. | A RED (not a far more intuitive GREEN) battery full symbol is shown at when the charge reaches 99.

A low battery is indicated by a flashing red AC plug symbol when the charge number on the LCD reaches 10.

Charge time was tested and found to be 82 minutes. | The question is, for how long, considering the flimsy construction of some components and the already below-specified battery life.

Things they don't describe in the mostly worthless manual:

The charging indicator is a steady red AC plug symbol.

The LCD indication at full charge is 99.
pos_snippets:
Wouldn't recommend or buy another. | If you're like And, of course,

As far as operating it, it's def one of the better ones However, Cleaning is easy.
neg_snippets: When opening the shaving head to clean, put a finger on it to slow its opening, otherwise it will rapidly flip open and if a razor element isn't locked into its place by its flimsy and not very intuitive to correctly replace locking ring, as it wasn't in Luckily, Had Didn't last. | These were either a bad manufacturing batch or they really do suck.
